results.title: Assault on the Land
results.creator_credit: Box Hill College of Technical and Further Education
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Rob Gell’s environment series”.
Examines the problems of salinity, showing how it affects not only the farmers, but all of us. Several methods currently in use to combat the problems are examined in areas of Victoria.

results.title: Assault on Precinct 13
results.creator_credit: John Carpenter, J Kaplan and CKK Corporation
results.brief_description: In John Carpenter’s low-budget classic, the skeleton crew of a ghetto police station fights off a horde of street thugs who are seeking revenge against a locked-up prisoner. It’s a ‘Rio Bravo’ for the lawless modern age; once the siege starts, the screen appears to explode in bullets and flying glass. The action is so raw it doesn’t seem choreographed, so fast it doesn’t seem plausible.

results.title: Assault on human dignity
results.brief_description: An IFAG report by Kurt Bethge which investigates to political maneuvering in the Soviet occupied zone of Germany which led to the erection of the Berlin Wall, and how this affected the people in West Berlin, when world attention was focussed on those in East Berlin.

results.title: Assassins d'eau douce (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Jean Painleve and Comptoir Francais du Film Documentaire
results.brief_description: A study of the life of carnivorous freshwater larvae, with interesting jazz background music. Commentary in French. Was awarded the first prize in its section at the 1947 Brussels Film Festival.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jean Painleve and Comptoir Francais du Film Documentaire

results.title: Assassins
results.brief_description: In the criminal justice system, where convictions are made based on arguments being convincing beyond a reasonable doubt, editing factual media has the ability to create doubt, shedding new light on closed cases and can even right the wrongs of the justice system.

constellations_primary.name: Assassins: real world manifestations
constellations_primary.description: Ryan White’s documentary Assassins breaks down the wild true story of the assassination of North Korea’s Kim John-nam, diving into the political and personal motivations behind the event.

constellations_primary.name: Reasonable doubt
constellations_primary.description: Factual media has the power to reframe information and put forth new, persuasive arguments.  For the criminal justice system, where convictions are made based on arguments being convincing beyond a reasonable doubt, True Crime media has the ability to create doubt, right the wrongs of the justice system, and shed new light on closed cases.

results.description: In 2017, the estranged half-brother of North Korean leader Kim Jong-un was murdered in a crowded Malaysian airport. Poisoned in broad daylight, Kim Jong-nam’s death captured the world’s attention. It wasn’t just the victim’s high profile that had news desks in a flurry but the two unassuming young women at the centre of the attack. Wild stories emerged of them being highly trained North Korean spies equipped with poison lipstick while others suggested a bizarre tale of a video prank gone wrong.

results.title: Assassination at Sarajevo: pretext for war
results.creator_credit: Isaac Kleinerman, John Sharnik and CBS News
results.brief_description: This film discusses how the chain of events following the death of Archduke Franz Ferdinand in Serbia, allowed Austria to seek revenge and precipitate the outbreak of World War I. Suitable for Upper Secondary-Tertiatry students.

results.title: Assassin of youth
results.creator_credit: Elmer Clifton, Leo McCarthy and B C M Productions
results.brief_description: Joan is a good-natured teenager who, along with her sister, is set to receive her grandmother’s inheritance. When her grandmother is run over by a driver under the influence of marijuana, a reporter is sent to investigate. Meanwhile Joan’s scheming cousin Linda, intent on receiving the money herself, determines to have Joan dis-inherited by ruining her clean-cut reputation. The reporter on the case, who has fallen for Joan, discovers that Linda is a drug peddler and that Joan’s sister has become addicted to marijuana. “Assassin of youth” is an anti-drug teen propaganda movie typical of the 1930s. A fairly stilted and straightforward morality drama, this film has an almost transparent agenda, is patriarchal, traditionalist and simplistic in its politics. Nevertheless the film is a curiosity that is telling about the values of the era and perceived threat that teenagers under the influence posed to the status quo. Cast includes Luana Walters, Arthur Gardner, Fay McKenzie, Michael Owen, Dorothy Short, Dorothy Vaughan, Earl Dwire.

results.title: Assassin's Creed IV: Black Flag
results.brief_description: Assassin’s Creed IV Black Flag begins in 1715, when pirates established a lawless republic in the Caribbean and ruled the land and seas. These outlaws paralyzed navies, halted international trade, and plundered vast fortunes. They threatened the power structures that ruled Europe, inspired the imaginations of millions, and left a legacy that still endures.

constellations_other.name: Alice Babidge and True History of the Kelly Gang
constellations_other.description: An acclaimed set, costume, and production designer in the world of theatre, Alice Babidge has most recently been working in film including Justin Kurzel features Snowtown and True History Of The Kelly Gang.

results.description: Into this world sails a young, cocky, and fearsome captain named Edward Kenway. His skill with a sword and disdain for authority earn him the respect of pirate legends like Blackbeard, but thrust him into an ancient conflict that threatens to destroy everything the pirates have built.
description_for_label: Into this world sails a young, cocky, and fearsome captain named Edward Kenway. His skill with a sword and disdain for authority earn him the respect of pirate legends like Blackbeard, but thrust him into an ancient conflict that threatens to destroy everything the pirates have built.

results.title: Assassin's Creed
results.brief_description: Assassin’s Creed is a non-linear action-adventure video game, during which the player controls a 12th-century Levantine Assassin named Altaïr Ibn-La’Ahad during the Third Crusade, whose life is experienced through the Animus by his 21st century descendant, Desmond Miles.

constellations_other.name: The Australian industry
constellations_other.description: Though our local industry is small, our impact is huge!

results.description:
Desmond Miles, a bartender, is kidnapped by the company Abstergo Industries for use as a test subject in the “Animus,” a device that can simulate genetic memory. Abstergo intends to put Desmond in the device to recall the memories of his ancestor, Altaïr Ibn-La’Ahad, a member of the Assassin Brotherhood in the year 1191, who lived during the Third Crusade in the Holy Land. Initially, Desmond has trouble adjusting to the device, but eventually relives Altaïr’s exploits over the next several days. The game then primarily changes to Altaïr’s point-of-view, with occasional transitions to Desmond, due to problems with the Animus or onset of the Bleeding Effect.

The game opens with Desmond entering Altaïr’s memory, but he soon faces synchronization problems. On this, Lucy Stillman and Warren Vidic’s voices can be heard, arguing over Desmond’s safety within the Animus. After experiencing a few problems, Desmond exits the virtual machine and Vidic briefs him about the Animus’ inner workings, before initializing the machine’s tutorial program. After Desmond is done with the tutorial, he enters the closest synchronizable memory of Altaïr; Lucy adds that Desmond has to relive key moments of Altaïr’s life to increase his synchronization, before reaching the final memory which holds the information that Abstergo is seeking.

Altaïr is first shown attempting to retrieve one of a series of artifacts known as the “Pieces of Eden” from Solomon’s Temple with the help of Malik Al-Sayf, and his brother Kadar, but they are stopped by Robert de Sablé, Grand Master of the Knights Templar and sworn enemy of the Assassins. While retrieving the treasure, Altaïr breaks all three tenets of the Assassins’ Creed in an attempt to kill Robert, but he ultimately fails. In the following commotion, Malik’s brother is killed, and Malik’s left arm is crippled and later amputated. When Altaïr returns to the Assassins’ stronghold at Masyaf with apologies, Malik, who survived de Sablé, comes back with the artifact and disparages Altaïr because of his arrogance.

After narrowly defeating a retaliatory attack by the Templars, Al Mualim, leader of the Assassins, demotes Altaïr to a novice but gives him another chance to rise through the ranks of the Brotherhood. Al Mualim assigns Altaïr the task of assassinating nine key figures across the Holy Land in Jerusalem, Acre and Damascus, aiming to bring peace between the Crusader and Saracen forces. Each target is based on an actual historical figure from the Third Crusade, including Majd Addin, Garnier de Naplouse, Jubair al Hakim, Abu’l Nuqoud, Sibrand, William of Montferrat, and Robert de Sablé.

Altaïr completes each task, learning how each target is connected to Robert and the Templars and how together they aim to end the Crusades and place the Holy Land under their own control. With men on both sides killed, he discovers that Robert’s last plot is to attempt to unite the Christian and Muslim forces against their new common enemy, the Assassins themselves. Altaïr defeats de Sablé before Richard the Lionheart, failing to convince the King that an end to the war would be welcome to both sides, but ending Robert’s plot. From de Sablé, Altaïr discovers that Al Mualim was himself a member of the Templars and used the Assassin to kill the other members who held the secret to the treasure’s power, so that he could selfishly keep the artifact for himself.

Altaïr quickly returns to Masyaf and approaches his master, who reveals the truth to him: the Piece of Eden, which he had recovered through the help of Altaïr directly before his transgression, creates illusions. He denounces religion and other seemingly supernatural events (e.g. the Ten Plagues of Egypt, the parting of the Red Sea, and the presence of the Greek Gods in the Trojan War) as illusions caused by the Piece, and then states his intention to use the artifact to compel mankind into a brainwashed state, and in doing so, bringing an end to all conflict; Altaïr is eventually able to see through the deceptions created by the artifact to kill Al Mualim. When Altaïr recovers the artifact, the Piece of Eden activates, showing a holographic view of the world with numerous locations of other Pieces of Eden marked across the globe.

When the process is complete, Desmond learns that Abstergo is a modern-day front of the Templars, and they are already seeking other artifacts at locations identified in Altaïr’s memories. Further, he learns that the modern-day Assassins had tried to rescue him before the memory had completed but had failed. Following this, Desmond was to be killed after an order from a high-ranking Templar, Alan Rikkin, but Lucy Stillman saves him from death and, at one point, tucks her ring finger into her palm, referring to the Assassins’ tradition of cutting off the finger.

Though Desmond remains trapped in the Abstergo laboratory, his experience in the Animus has created a Bleeding Effect of Altaïr’s life in his own, allowing Desmond to use Altaïr’s Eagle Vision, which, in turn, allows him to see strange messages painted on the walls of his room and the floor of the lab. The messages all deal with various forms of the end of the world from different cultures, including several references to 21 December 2012, the date that Abstergo plans to launch a satellite that will “permanently end the war.” It is hinted that this method would be by the same method that Al Mualim hypnotized Masyaf, only on a larger scale. Finally, the game ends with Desmond wondering what the images all mean and who could have drawn them.

results.title: Assassin's Creed
results.headline_credit: France, Hong Kong, Malta, Taiwan, United Kingdom and United States of America, 2016
results.brief_description: Through unlocked genetic memories that allow him to relive the adventures of his ancestor in 15th century Spain, Callum Lynch discovers he’s a descendant of the secret ‘Assassins’ society. After gaining incredible knowledge and skills, he is now poised to take on the oppressive Knights Templar in the present day.

constellations_other.name: The Australian industry
constellations_other.description: Though our local industry is small, our impact is huge!
